intro: Pseudogynoxys engleri, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a shrub native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by violet or purple berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrub habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
